content.description:
Dido and Aeneas in a Cave

Speluncamspelunca, -am, f.: cave Dido dux et Troianus eandem
deveniuntdevenio, -ire = venio, -ire. Prima et Tellus et pronubapronuba, -ae, f.: matron of honor Iuno
dant signum. Fulserefulgeo, -ere, fulsi: to flash1 ignes et consciusconscius, -a, -um, adj.: aware, privy to aether
conubiis summoque ulularuntululo, -are: to wail2 vertice Nymphae.

Line 5Ille dies primus letiletum, -i, n. = mors, -tis primusque malorum
causa fuit.

Aeneid 4.165-170
 1:Fulsere = Fulserunt↩
2:ulularunt = ululaverunt↩
content.question: Translate the passage as literally as possible.

frqParts.text: Translate the passage as literally as possible.
